;国家主席习近平（第二周一，美国参议院多数党领袖查克·舒默（左三）率领的美国国会代表团在北京会见。

;

; 中美应妥善处理两国关系，以及“中国如何处理”习近平主席在人民大会堂会见美国参议院多数党领袖舒默率领的美国参议院两党代表团时指出，中美相处将决定人类未来。

;

;周一下午，人们在北京。

;

; 分析人士称，由于台湾问题和美国对中国半导体行业的制裁等因素，世界两大经济体之间的关系一直紧张

;

; 习近平表示，两国要相互尊重、和平共处、合作共赢。习近平还强调，中美关系在世界和平与发展中的重要地位。他表示，中美作为两个大国，应该“展现大国的博大胸怀、远见卓识和责任担当”。

;

; 此外，两国要处理好两国关系，“本着对历史、对人民、对世界负责的态度”。

;

;关于两国分歧，他表示，竞争和对抗不符合时代潮流，解决不了两国问题。他指出，中美两国的共同利益远大于分歧，“中美各自的成功是机遇，而不是机遇”。

;

; 引用政治学术语“修昔底德陷阱”来解释这一点。 —用于解释崛起的大国何时可能引起老牌强国的恐惧和不安全感，从而导致对抗甚至战争——习近平表示，这个陷阱“并非不可避免”。

;

; “地球幅员辽阔，足以容纳中美各自发展和共同繁荣”。

;

; 至于双边合作，习近平表示，中美经济深度融合，可以从彼此的发展中受益。

;

; 19日疫情、应对气候变化、解决国际地区热点问题需要双方协调配合。

;

; 舒默率领的美国代表团介绍了有关问题的看法和看法。

;

; 代表团成员表示，美中关系稳定发展不仅对两国至关重要，也关系到世界和平与发展。

; <他们表示，中国的发展繁荣造福于美国人民，美国不寻求与中国发生冲突。

;

; 他们补充说，美国也不寻求脱钩。

;

; 代表团成员表示，美方期待加强双边贸易投资合作，并在应对气候变化、打击贩毒、解决地区冲突等问题上加强沟通与合作。

;

;观察人士表示，这次会议体现了中方为减少误判、推动两国关系走出低谷而展现的博大胸怀和建设性做法。

;

; 王栋，全球合作研究院教授、执行所长北京大学理解表示，这次会晤是“中国国家元首为呼吁和帮助美国议员正确认识中国、推动改善中美关系所做的一次令人印象深刻、和蔼可亲的个人努力”。

;

; “习近平呼吁大国博大胸怀，传递出的信息是，华盛顿不应沉迷于维护霸权和一己私利。”

;

; 中国国际问题研究所副所长苏晓晖说。美国研究部表示，双方在会晤中重申了两国关系的重要性，北京方面明确表示，修复美方对两国关系造成的损害需要摆脱冷战思维和零和博弈的做法

;

; “美方在会上的言论表明，美国联邦、国会和州层面也已经意识到，美国不可能完全脱离中国，他们也不愿意这样做，”

;

; “推动两国关系重回正轨，关键在于务实合作，双方应努力确保已建立的合作机制正常、平稳运行。”这将有利于双方管控分歧、稳定关系。”她说。

;

; 美国代表团于周六抵达上海，还将前往陕西省西安市。

;

; 习近平告诉美国议员，更多的美国代表团成员将前往陕西省西安市。欢迎国会议员访问中国“更好地了解中国的过去、现在和未来”。

;

;他还表示希望两国立法机构能够有更多的互访，

;

; 美国国会议员向习近平表示，很高兴访问中国，赞赏中方的支持和支持。盛情款待，让他们感受到了国家发展的活力和潜力。

;

; 美方愿本着开放、坦诚、相互尊重的精神，同中方加强对话与沟通，管理两国

;

; 美方代表团还会见了全国人大常委会委员长赵乐际，外交部长王毅周一在北京。

;

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 05:21:05 +0800 001FRONT - Nation reveals plan to boost computing power, digital economyhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/10/content_001_6524679eed50d203d2ca0256.htm#001FRONT
;
;

; 中国的目标是到 2025 年将其总计算能力提高 30% 以上，该计划扩大了数字基础设施的规模，这对于提振国家蓬勃发展的数字经济和计算能力粗略地定义为处理数据的能力，包括信息基础设施和支撑时代信息计算能力、数据存储和网络能力的技术。

;

; 工信部等六部门周一发布的《规划》称，我国计划到2025年总算力达到300 EFLOPS。EFLOPS是计算机系统速度的单位。它相当于每秒 1 百亿次浮点运算。

;

; 工信部在 8 月份透露，中国的计算能力今年已达到 197 EFLOPS，高于 2022 年的 180 EFLOPS。该部将中国列为计算力全球排名第二，仅次于美国。

;

; 接近工信部的消息人士向《中国日报》透露，不同国家算力的具体规模并没有公开的官方数据，排名是根据总部位于北京的智库中国信息通信研究院（CAICT）的估计。

;

; 该研究院估计，美国的计算能力将在 2022 年达到 200 EFLOPS，并且今年一直在稳步增长

;

; 到 2025 年，中国很难在计算能力上超越美国，部分原因是后者限制向我们出口高端处理器，但该计划是一个雄心勃勃的计划消息人士补充道，中国正在推动提高计算能力并推动经济增长。

;

; 中国工程院院士邬贺铨表示，计算能力是数字经济的新引擎，吴说，以创新为驱动的计算是中国经济实力的主要增长动力。

;

;每投资1元算力，将带动3至4元GDP的经济增长。

;

; p>;

; 吴表示，由于人工智能训练需要大量计算，在全球人工智能领导者争夺战中，扩大计算能力的供应变得越来越重要。

;

;根据中国信息通信研究院的数据，到 2022 年，中国核心算力产业规模将达到 1.8 万亿元人民币（2,468 亿美元）。

;

;中国信息通信研究院院长于晓辉表示，“中国”算力产业五年来平均增长近30%，AI算力对应的数字为45%。”

;

; AI算力目前占比超过25%于补充说，最新的计划旨在到 2025 年将这一比例提高到 35%，以更好地推动正在进行的人工智能热潮。

;

; >; 工业和信息化部部长金壮龙此前表示，将加大力度加强计算算法和关键芯片产品等领域的自主创新，其中GPU是中国最受欢迎的支持人工智能的处理器

;

; 中国移动董事长杨杰表示，“我们将努力让算力像水、电一样普遍、好用。”

;

; 杨表示，公司正在建设亚洲最大的人工智能计算中心。

;巴勒斯坦居民与救援人员寻回周一，以色列在加沙地带南部拉法的袭击中摧毁了一所房屋废墟中的一具尸体。

;

; 中国周一重申，它“反对并谴责”这一行为。以巴冲突造成的死亡人数已近1400人，暴力侵害平民事件不断发生。

;

; 外交部发言人毛宁在北京举行的新闻发布会上表示，中方坚决反对扩大冲突、破坏地区稳定的行为。她补充说，北京希望尽快停火、结束冲突、恢复和谈。

;

; 毛泽东呼吁国际社会有效发挥作用，共同努力降温。周一，以色列军队在该国南部搜寻哈马斯战士，用坦克守卫边境围栏的缺口，并从空中轰炸了加沙地带。< /p>;

; 在周末史无前例的入侵之后，以色列发誓要全面包围哈马斯统治的贫困领土，并表示已派遣特种部队从哈马斯武装分子手中夺取四个地点的控制权。

;

; >;

; 以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡周日宣布该国“处于战争状态”。并要求以色列人为“漫长而艰难”的战争做好准备。

;

; 对此，中方敦促有关各方保持冷静、克制，立即停止敌对行动，保护平民，避免事态进一步升级。

;

;周一早上的几个地点。据报道，以色列至少有 800 人被杀——该国数十年来从未经历过如此规模的惊人伤亡——加沙地带已有 560 多人被杀。

;

; 冲突产生了全球影响，多个国家报告其国民被杀、绑架或失踪。

;

; 至少有 9 名联合国人员被杀美国国务院周一在一份声明中表示，有各国公民在冲突中丧生，并补充说，仍有数量不明的美国公民失踪且下落不明。

;

; 泰国表示，至少有 12 名本国国民被杀，而尼泊尔报告有 10 人死亡。他们都是在以色列工作的劳工。

;

; 联合国周一表示，自周六新一轮暴力事件爆发以来，加沙已有超过 123,000 人流离失所。

;骑手在亚运会。浙江省桐庐县迎来了来自20多个国家和地区的110多名骑手和114匹马匹参加本届运动会。

; ;

;周五亚运会期间，车手对观众做出回应。

; ;

;香港赛马会马术事务主管阿曼达·邦德 (Amanda Bond) 与马一起工作。

; ;

;桐庐马术中心正在照料马匹。

;

; 桐庐县，浙江省因其文化和历史景点而于 2021 年被《国家地理》杂志评选为全球 25 个最佳旅游目的地之一。

;

; 该县长期以来以风景而闻名，但从未如此近年来，桐庐已成为享誉全球的马术目的地，接待了来自20多个国家和地区的110多名骑手和114匹马参加赛事。周日结束的亚运会。

;

;香港丰富的马术遗产和国际资源是香港在马术界迅速崛起的动力。

; < p>; 9月25日，亚运会马术比赛开幕前一天，香港特别行政区行政长官李家超视察桐庐马术中心。

;

;是中国主办的大型国际体育赛事之一，李说：“这一次，香港不仅是参与者，也是贡献者。”

;

; 桐庐主要以其旅游目的地和旅游目的地而闻名。物流服务。这里也是数百家快递公司的所在地，但通过举办亚运会马术赛事，它获得了新的身份。

;

; 当地公园和街道上展出马术艺术品，展出马的雕塑和肖像。商店里陈列着以马为主题的商品，还有众多相关纪念品。

;

; 桐庐马术中心是专门为马术活动建造的场地，占地超过295公顷，受到了全球马术界的认可和好评。< /p>;

; 来自马来西亚的六届亚运会选手、今年盛装舞步个人赛金牌得主卡比勒·安巴克 (Qabil Ambak) 称赞该中心是“历届亚运会最好的场馆之一”。< /p>;

; 在个人盛装舞步比赛中获得银牌的香港运动员萧咏莹表示，该中心为马匹提供了世界一流的环境，而马术协会主席哈马德·本·阿卜杜拉赫曼·阿提亚 (Hamad bin Abdulrahman Al Attiyah) 则表示，该中心为马匹提供了世界一流的环境。亚洲马术联合会表示，所有骑手都对能够在中心比赛表示感谢。

;

; 香港赛马会 (HKJC) 马术事务主管阿曼达·邦德 (Amanda Bond) –世界上最大的马术组织之一——

;

; 拥有30多年马术经验的香港马术专家表示，香港拥有丰富的马术经验，在桐庐的新形象中发挥了至关重要的作用。邦德表示，香港分享了其知识、专业知识和指导，帮助桐庐克服马术经验不足的问题。

;

;香港赛马会为亚运会马术项目提供了大量技术支持。

;

;俱乐部专家被选为马术项目指挥中心顾问。 5月，俱乐部还与组委会签署了谅解备忘录（MOU），为亚运会提供六大领域的技术支持——生物安全、马匹运输、马厩管理、兽医和蹄铁匠服务、场馆运营以及国际利益相关者参与。

;

; ;主要贡献者;

;

; 邦德表示，谅解备忘录是结构化的”围绕赛马会的核心专业知识。

;

; “我们专注于我们拥有丰富经验的领域，所以从技术角度来看，这并没有太大的挑战性，”她说。

;

; 尽管如此，俱乐部从高层领导到下层都致力于确保马术赛事的成功举办。

;

; 自去年秋季以来，大约 14 名俱乐部核心工作人员和 20 名其他成员则承担着不同的角色，除了在赛马会全职工作外，他们每月都会前往桐庐备战奥运会。此外，俱乐部还聘请了六名兽医和蹄铁师专业人士提供专业指导和支持。

;

; 香港队伍与当地同行密切合作，分享专业知识、提供指导、制定策略和实施计划 -贡献综合经验，帮助赛事从筹备阶段到结束。

;

; 例如，来自世界各地的 100 多匹马在不同时间抵达和出发参加比赛，马匹运输是一项复杂的任务，需要及早进行战略规划。

;

; 安全安置在航空马厩中的马匹乘坐指定的飞机从世界各地的枢纽飞往杭州萧山国际机场。为了保护他们的健康，他们从机场通过专门的生物安全通道，乘坐专门设计的空调卡车直接到达桐庐。

;

; 马会与活动主办方分享马匹运输经验，向他们推荐物流合作伙伴在飞马参加竞技赛事方面拥有丰富的经验。

;

; 俱乐部向当地政府部门提供了维护特殊生物安全通道的建议 -成功地将马匹带到奥运会并安全返回祖国。

;

; 此外，俱乐部还在建立一个复杂且具有挑战性的项目——马匹无疫区（EDFZ）方面发挥了支持作用。 .

;

; 区内维持严格的卫生标准，以保护马匹免受外来疾病的潜在风险。建立这样的区域对于国际马术运动确保马匹的健康和安全至关重要。这项工作需要与当地政府部门密切合作，与国际社会进行有效沟通，并得到世界动物卫生组织的批准。

;

; 过去，中国举办大型活动时，因缺乏相关资源而面临障碍。无疫区。例如，2008年北京奥运会的马术比赛由于当​​时中国内地没有马匹免检疫区而迁往香港。

;

; 2010年亚运会俱乐部在广东省省会广州市帮助该市建立了内地首个经济自由区。

;

; 在桐庐，俱乐部分享了与内地政府部门合作建立经济自由区的成功经验以及与国际社会的交流。这项工作帮助桐庐成功建立了约1300平方公里的大片无疫区。

;

; 俱乐部在营造舒适的环境、帮助马匹发挥最佳表现方面也发挥了重要作用。它确保他们在抵达中心后获得优质的住宿、食物、医疗和其他基本服务。

;

; 它还提供了有关建设和管理马厩和马术比赛场地的丰富建议。

;

;该中心拥有240个独立马厩，每匹马都被安置在16平方米的房间里，温度保持在24摄氏度。为防止发生事故，所有通道和马匹表面都铺有防滑橡胶垫。马厩从早上 5 点到晚上 10 点开放，为运动员和支持团队提供了充足的时间与马匹相处。晚上，安全小组保护马匹的安全。

;

; 比赛区域的沙子保持在20厘米最佳深度。

;

; 中心778平方米的兽医诊所的建设，由来自中国的兽医专家监督建造。香港赛马会。这个最先进的设施为马匹提供一流的医疗护理，那些需要医疗护理的马匹可以尽快得到最好的治疗。

;

; 马匹有自己的饮食偏好。亚运会之前，俱乐部和主办方整理了所有马匹的饲养喜好，解决了各种程序难题，确保了马匹的饲料能够从世界各地进口到杭州。

;

; 邦德说：“我们支持组织者批准进口数百种不同类型的饲料，以便马匹可以吃在家里吃的东西。”

;

; 俱乐部还帮助组织者与国际利益相关者进行协调。< /p>;

; 它协助与总部位于卡塔尔的亚洲马术联合会、总部位于瑞士的国际马术运动联合会以及来自英国的航运代理商进行联络。它还有助于与参加亚运会的各国单项体育联合会的代表进行联络。

;

; 邦德表示，为了与不同各方进行联络，俱乐部成员经常牺牲睡眠来跨时区举行会议。 “这有点像为联合国工作，”她补充道。

;

; 此外，马会还为约 60 名来自香港的志愿者提供了培训，以进一步协助奥运会。

;

; 举办了马术历史、马匹护理和其他课程。为志愿者提供担任各种角色的基础知识。抵达杭州后，志愿者们担任翻译、接待服务、媒体宣传等工作。

;

; “我们确保他们了解马术运动。无论个人在场馆的具体角色如何，他或她都可以回答有关活动和比赛的问题。”邦德说。

;

;“一切都很顺利。与运动员们一起——人和马——能够打出最好的表现，我们就可以高兴地回到香港。”

;

;

;

;

; “作为一项包容性的运动，马术让我们充满自豪。”邦德说，并补充说，组织此类活动可以提高当地人对这项运动的认识。

;

; 她补充说，这些活动还可以消除马术运动本质上是危险的误解。

;

; “人们可以了解到只要训练有素、使用正确的骑马方法并尊重马匹，马术运动并不比其他运动更危险。” ”她说。

;

; 6月，国家队获得马术参赛资格明年巴黎奥运会铁人三项团体赛资格赛。杭州亚运会，国家队夺得两枚金牌，占马术运动金牌数的三分之一。

; 她又表示，与欧洲相比，亚洲国家之间马匹转移面临更大的挑战，而这些问题是阻碍了整个地区马术的发展。为了消除马术发展的障碍，她呼吁亚洲国家共同努力，实现马匹跨境流动，并加强这方面的国际合作。

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 05:21:05 +0800 002PAGE TWO - TONGLU FIRMLY IN THE SADDLE AFTER ASIAD EQUESTRIAN SUCCESShttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/10/content_002_652467a7ed50d203d2ca025a.htm#002PAGE TWO
;
;;

;骑手在亚运会。浙江省桐庐县迎来了来自20多个国家和地区的110多名骑手和114匹马匹参加本届运动会。

; ;

;周五亚运会期间，车手对观众做出回应。

; ;

;香港赛马会马术事务主管阿曼达·邦德 (Amanda Bond) 与马一起工作。

; ;

;桐庐马术中心正在照料马匹。

;

; 桐庐县，浙江省因其文化和历史景点而于 2021 年被《国家地理》杂志评选为全球 25 个最佳旅游目的地之一。

;

; 该县长期以来以风景而闻名，但从未如此近年来，桐庐已成为享誉全球的马术目的地，接待了来自20多个国家和地区的110多名骑手和114匹马参加赛事。周日结束的亚运会。

;

;香港丰富的马术遗产和国际资源是香港在马术界迅速崛起的动力。

; < p>; 9月25日，亚运会马术比赛开幕前一天，香港特别行政区行政长官李家超视察桐庐马术中心。

;

;是中国主办的大型国际体育赛事之一，李说：“这一次，香港不仅是参与者，也是贡献者。”

;

; 桐庐主要以旅游目的地和旅游胜地而闻名。物流服务。 It is also home to hundreds of express delivery companies, but by hosting the Asiad equestrian events, it took on a new identity.

;

; Equestrian artwork featured in local parks and streets, with sculptures and portraits of horses on display. Shops boasted merchandise themed on horses, and numerous related souvenirs.

;

; Tonglu Equestrian Centre, the purpose-built arena for equestrian events, covers more than 295 hectares and has received recognition and acclaim from the global equestrian community.

;

; Qabil Ambak, a six-time Asian Games participant from Malaysia and gold medalist in the individual dressage competition this year, praised the center for being "one of the finest venues in all of the Asian Games".

;

; Jacqueline Siu Wing-ying, a Hong Kong athlete who won the silver medal in the individual dressage event, said the center provided a world-class environment for the horses, while Hamad bin Abdulrahman Al Attiyah, president of the Asian Equestrian Federation, said all the riders were grateful to compete at the center.

;

; Amanda Bond, head of equestrian affairs at the Hong Kong Jockey Club, or HKJC, — one of the largest equine organizations in the world — said Hong Kong, with its wealth of equestrian experience, has played a crucial role in Tonglu's new identity.

;

; An equestrian expert with more than 30 years' experience, Bond said Hong Kong shared its knowledge, expertise and guidance to help Tonglu overcome its lack of equestrian experience.

;

; The HKJC provided substantial technical support for the Asian Games equestrian events.

;

; Experts from the club were chosen as advisers for the equestrian project command center. In May, the club also signed a memorandum of understanding, or MOU, with the organizing committee to provide technical support in six areas for the Asian Games — biosecurity, horse transportation, stable management, veterinary and farrier services, venue operations, and international stakeholder engagement.

;

; ;Major contributor;

;

; Bond said the MOU was structured around the Jockey Club's core expertise.

;

; "We focused on areas where we have rich experience, so from a technical perspective, it wasn't too challenging," she said.

;

; Still, the club was committed from its senior leadership down to ensuring the equestrian events were run successfully.

;

; Since autumn last year, some 14 core club staff members and 20 other members have taken on various roles, traveling to Tonglu every month to prepare for the Games, in addition to their full-time work at the Jockey Club. In addition, six veterinary and farrier professionals were engaged by the club to offer professional guidance and support.

;

; The Hong Kong contingent worked closely with local counterparts to share expertise, offer guidance, devise strategies and implement plans — contributing the combined experience to help the events from the preparatory stage to conclusion.

;

; For example, with more than 100 horses from around the world arriving and departing at varying times for competitions, equine transportation was a complex task that required early strategic planning.

;

; Horses housed safely in air stalls were flown on designated aircraft from worldwide hubs to Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport. To protect their health, they passed through a dedicated biosecure channel directly from the airport to reach Tonglu in specially designed air-conditioned trucks.

;

; The HKJC shared its experience in equine transportation with event organizers, recommending to them a logistics partner with wide experience in flying horses to competitive events.

;

; The club advised local government departments on maintaining the special biosecure channel — successfully bringing the horses to the Games and returning them safely to their home countries.

;

; In addition, the club played a supporting role in setting up an intricate and challenging project, the Equine Disease-Free Zone, or EDFZ.

;

; Stringent hygiene standards were upheld in the zone to protect the horses from potential risks from imported diseases. Establishing such zones is crucial for international equine sport to ensure the health and safety of horses. This work requires close cooperation with local government departments, effective communication with the international community, and approval from the World Organisation for Animal Health.

;

; In the past, China faced obstacles in hosting major events due to a lack of epidemic-free zones. For instance, the equestrian events for the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games were relocated to Hong Kong due to the absence of a quarantine-free zone for horses on the Chinese mainland at that time.

;

; For the 2010 Asian Games in Guangzhou, capital of Guangdong province, the club helped the city establish the mainland's first EDFZ.

;

; In Tonglu, the club shared its successful experience of setting up EDFZs, collaborating with government departments on the mainland, and communicating with the international community. This work helped Tonglu successfully establish a vast disease-free zone covering about 1,300 square kilometers.

;

; The club also played a significant role in establishing a comfortable environment to help the horses perform to their best. It ensured they were provided with exceptional accommodations, food, medical treatment and other essential services upon arriving at the center.

;

; It also offered a wealth of advice on building and managing stables and competitive equestrian competition areas.

;

; The center boasts 240 individual stables, with each horse housed in 16-square-meter rooms where the temperature is maintained at 24 C. To prevent accidents, non-slip rubber mats lined all the passageways and surfaces on which the horses trod.

;

; The stables were open from 5 am to 10 pm, offering athletes and support teams sufficient time to spend with the horses. At night, a security team protected the horses' safety.

;

; Sand in the competition areas was maintained at an optimum depth of 20 centimeters.

;

; Construction of the 778-square-meter veterinary clinic at the center was supervised by veterinary experts from the HKJC. This state-of-the-art facility provides first-class medical care for horses, with those that require medical attention receiving the best treatment as soon as possible.

;

; The horses have their own dietary preferences. Before the Asian Games, the club and the organizers collated the feeding preferences of all the horses and resolved various procedural difficulties to ensure their feed could be imported to Hangzhou from destinations across the world.

;

; Bond said, "We supported the organizers in achieving approval for hundreds of different types of feed to be imported so that the horses could eat what they eat at home."

;

; The club also helped the organizers coordinate with international stakeholders.

;

; It assisted in liaising with the Asian Equestrian Federation, which is based in Qatar, and with the International Federation for Equestrian Sports, headquartered in Switzerland, as well as with shipping agents from the United Kingdom. It also helped liaise with representatives from national federations attending the Asian Games.

;

; Bond said that to liaise with different parties, club members often sacrificed sleep to hold meetings across different time zones. "It's been a bit like working for the United Nations," she added.

;

; In addition, the club helped provide training for about 60 volunteers from Hong Kong to further assist with the Games.

;

; It gave lessons on equestrian history, equine care and other basics to equip volunteers for various roles. After arriving in Hangzhou, volunteers worked as translators, provided hospitality services, performed media and publicity work, among other tasks.

;

; "We made sure they understood equestrian sport. No matter an individual's specific role at the venue, he or she could answer questions about the events and competitions," Bond said.

;

; "Everything ran smoothly. With the athletes — both humans and horses — able to perform at their best, we could return to Hong Kong happy."

;

; ;Using a legacy;

;

; Bond feels that after the Asian Games, the passion and interest in equestrian sports will continue in Tonglu and throughout the mainland.

;

; Equestrianism holds a unique place among sports, she said.

;

; It is the only sport at the Asian Games and the Olympic Games that involves interaction with animals, which can teach humans to respect animals. It is also the only sport at both these major events in which male and female athletes compete at the same stage. In addition, it has no age restrictions, with competitors in international equestrian events ranging from teenagers to riders in their 70s and above.

;

; "As an inclusive sport, equestrianism fills us with pride," Bond said, adding that organizing such events can increase local appreciation of the sport.

;

; The events can also dispel the misconception that equestrianism is inherently dangerous, she added.

;

; "People can learn that as long as they're trained well, use the right methods to ride, and show respect for the horse, equestrianism is no more dangerous than other sports," she said.

;

; Efforts are also underway to preserve the legacy of the Asian Games.

;

; Bond said the HKJC will cooperate with the authorities in Hangzhou to further explore the use of Games venues and facilities.

;

; In June, the club signed an MOU with the Hangzhou government to strengthen cooperation and exchanges to drive development of the equine sports industry in the country. Both sides will work together to explore new operating models for the existing venues in Hangzhou, such as developing a post-Asian Games plan for use of the Tonglu Equestrian Centre.

;

; They will explore cooperation for national and regional equestrian events, horse-riding education, and cultural tourism. They will also strengthen talent development, and the club will provide training for equine sports professionals, veterinary and farrier services, and stable management.

;

; It will strive to boost the popularity of equine sports through community activities, education programs and media publicity to raise public awareness and participation.

;

; Hong Kong and the mainland have collaborated in equestrian work for several years, Bond said, adding that she has witnessed the remarkable progress of equestrian sports on the mainland over the past two decades.

;

; The number of equestrian clubs on the mainland has risen from 1,000 in 2017 to more than 3,000 this year.

;

; In June, the national team secured entry to the equestrian triathlon team event at the Paris Olympics next year in the qualification round. At the Asian Games in Hangzhou, the national team won two gold medals, one-third of the total number of golds for equestrian sport.

;

; Bond said that as the Asian Games proved that the mainland has the ability to host top-tier equestrian events, the HKJC hopes more such events can be held on the mainland.

;

; She also said that compared with Europe, there are greater challenges in moving horses between Asian nations, and these problems are hindering the advancement of equestrianism across the region. To remove obstacles to equestrian growth, she called on Asian countries to work together to enable cross-border equine mobility and increase international cooperation in this respect.

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 05:21:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Trial guideline unveiled to tighten management of sci-tech ethics reviewhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/10/content_003_652467aded50d203d2ca025c.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

; China has released a trial guideline on the review of science and technology ethics to ensure both high-quality development and high-level security in sci-tech innovation.

;

; The guideline was jointly released by the ministries of science and technology, industry and information technology, and education, the National Health Commission and other departments with the aim of tackling problems such as unclear responsibilities, nonstandard procedures and imperfect mechanisms for ethical reviews in the sci-tech sector.

;

; Activities involving human research participants, human biological samples and personal information data, as well as those related to experimental animals, must face ethical reviews, according to the guideline.

;

; It delineated a major range of reviews with focusing on activities that may pose ethical risks and challenges in areas such as life and health, ecological environment, public order and sustainable development.

;

; The guideline also stipulated entities responsible for managing sci-tech ethics review in higher education, research, medical and health institutions and enterprises.

;

; A review committee is required to be established in institutions engaging in life sciences, medicine and artificial intelligence activities if the research subjects are "ethically sensitive".

;

; The committee must conduct follow-up ethical reviews of the approved sci-tech activities and make decisions to suspend or terminate such activities if necessary, the guideline said, adding that the interval between follow-up reviews must not exceed 12 months.

;

; The guideline specified a range of activities that need to undergo a "second ethics review", targeting those activities that may pose "relatively high" ethical risks.

;

; The list, which will be dynamically adjusted, has been released by the Ministry of Science and Technology. It covers basic research that alter the genetic material or genetic laws of human reproductive cells and fertilized eggs, and the development of algorithm models, applications and systems with the ability to "mobilize public opinion and guide social consciousness".

;

; Zhai Xiaomei, a member of the National Science and Technology Ethics Committee, said the guideline provides a comprehensive and universally applicable bench mark for ethical review in different sci-tech activities.

;

; It will help overcome problems previously encountered in ethical review work such as coordination difficulties and the lack of unified evaluation criteria, she said.

;

; Zhai said that many emerging technological research and development projects currently have significant social value and are in line with the public interest, but they also pose certain risks. "For example, in research involving the use of data and biological samples, there are risks related to protecting the privacy of sample providers and ensuring biosecurity."

;

; She said that sci-tech activities are closely related to people's lives, and people are increasingly concerned about the misuse of scientific achievements. "Ethical review plays a key role in regulating and curbing such risks."

;

; Public awareness of ethical risks increased after Chinese researcher He Jiankui claimed in 2018 that he had created the world's first gene-edited baby immune to HIV.

;

; In 2019, He was sentenced to three years in prison and fined 3 million yuan ($412,000) for illegal practices including forging ethical approval documents and practicing medicine without a license.

;

; Last year, the central government released a set of guidelines to strengthen ethics governance in science and technology, given the rapid progress of China's sci-tech innovation and the growing challenges in the field.

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 05:21:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Plan focuses on development of education in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei regionhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/10/content_003_652467b3ed50d203d2ca025e.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;

; The municipalities of Beijing and Tianjin along with Hebei province have enacted a new plan to promote coordinated development of education from 2023 to 2025, covering areas such as school construction and teacher exchanges.

;

; The plan states that the education authorities of the three areas will promote the coordinated development of basic education in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei region and continue to carry out exchanges and mutual learning activities among teachers and principals from kindergartens, as well as primary and secondary schools, according to a high-level meeting held on Sunday, which was attended by educational heads and school leaders from the region.

;

; "The education administrative departments of Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei will work together to improve the coordination level in the field of education and strive to create a new picture under the guidance of the central government," Li Yi, director of the Beijing Municipal Education Commission, said at the meeting.

;

; The plan includes measures to help raise the level of educational facilities in Xiong'an New Area in Hebei province by bringing in resources from Beijing and Tianjin to provide high-quality educational services for the local residents and children of relocated personnel in Xiong'an.

;

; Many well-known schools and educational groups from Beijing have set up branches in Xiong'an in the past few years. These include Zhong Guan Cun No 3 Primary School Education Group, Beijing No 4 High School, Beijing Shijia Hutong Primary School and Beijing Beihai Kindergarten. Many of these schools have started taking in students.

;

; "We have not only built a campus in Xiong'an, but are also bringing in our experienced teachers and experts here to support the development of local education," said Yang Gang, president of Zhong Guan Cun No 3 Primary School Education Group which has built a branch campus in Xiong'an. The new branch school of Zhong Guan Cun No 3 Primary School Education Group welcomed its first group of 183 students in September.

;

; "We will continue to strengthen teacher exchanges and communication between Beijing and Xiong'an to bring advanced educational concepts here for the local children," Yang said.

;

; Currently, 202 primary and secondary schools and kindergartens from Beijing and Tianjin have educational cooperation projects with 273 schools and kindergartens in Hebei. Tsinghua University and Renmin University of China have provided assistance to 10 high schools in Hebei.

;

; According to the plan, both Beijing and Tianjin will send excellent management teams to Xiong'an to strengthen sharing of resources in the education sector.

;

; To promote cross-regional cooperation, the governments of the three areas will establish education groups, school alliances and partnerships to enhance the sharing of educational resources around Beijing, such as in the cities of Zhangjiakou and Chengde in Hebei, to jointly improve regional educational standards, said the plan.

;

; "Hebei has already achieved remarkable results in the coordinated development of education over the past years. Next, we will make efforts on serving Beijing and Tianjin in some sectors," said Dong Zhaowei, vice-governor of Hebei.

;

; Up to 15 vocational colleges in the region have initiated cross-provincial admissions and joint training programs for middle- and high-level vocational education. The three areas have jointly established 16 university alliances.

;

; "Since the majority of graduates of Hebei's vocational colleges have found jobs in Beijing and Tianjin, supporting the development of vocational education in Hebei is a way of helping Beijing and Tianjin to cultivate talents," said Bu Lixin, Party secretary of Chengde College of Applied Technology, during an interview with Beijing Business Today.

;

; "Meanwhile, strengthening the cooperation in vocational education between Hebei and Beijing-Tianjin can also provide more employment and development opportunities for students from Hebei, which is a win-win situation for the three places."

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 05:21:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Xi underlines global impact of tieshttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/10/content_003_652467b3ed50d203d2ca025f.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

;President Xi Jinping (second from right) meets with a United States congressional delegation led by Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (third from left) in Beijing on Monday.

;

; China and the United States should properly handle their relations, and "how China and the US get along will determine the future of humanity", President Xi Jinping said.

;

; Xi made the remark while meeting with a bipartisan US Senate delegation led by Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Monday afternoon.

;

; The relations between the world's top two economies have been tense due to factors such as the Taiwan question and US sanctions against China's semiconductor sector, analysts said.

;

; Xi said the two countries should respect each other, coexist in peace and pursue win-win cooperation. They also should boost the well-being of the two peoples, promote the progress of human society and contribute to world peace and development, he added.

;

; Xi also underlined the significance of China-US ties in the global context, calling it "the most important bilateral relationship in the world".

;

; He said that China and the US, as two major countries, should "demonstrate the broad-mindedness, vision and responsibility of major countries".

;

; In addition, the two countries should manage their relationship well and "act with a sense of responsibility to history, to the people and to the world".

;

; Speaking on divergences between the two nations, he said that competition and confrontation are not in line with the trend of the times and cannot solve the two countries' own problems or the challenges facing the world.

;

; He pointed out that the common interests of China and the US far outweigh their differences, and "the respective success of China and the US is an opportunity for, rather than a challenge to, each other".

;

; Citing the political science terminology "the Thucydides Trap" — used to explain when a rising power may cause fear and insecurity in an established power, leading to confrontation and even war — Xi said the trap "is not inevitable".

;

; "Planet Earth is vast enough to accommodate the respective development and common prosperity of China and the US," he added.

;

; As for bilateral cooperation, Xi said China and the US have seen deep economic integration and can benefit from each other's growth.

;

; Recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic, the response to climate change, and settlement of international and regional hot spot issues require coordination and cooperation between the two sides, he added.

;

; The US delegation led by Schumer introduced views and opinions on issues related to bilateral ties.

;

; Members of the delegation said that the stable development of US-China relations is not only vital to the two countries, but also has a bearing on world peace and development.

;

; They said China's development and prosperity benefit the US people, and the US does not seek conflict with China.

;

; The US also does not seek to decouple, they added.

;

; The US looks forward to strengthening bilateral trade and investment cooperation, as well as enhancing communication and cooperation on issues such as addressing climate change, combating drug trafficking and resolving regional conflicts, the delegation members said.

;

; Observers said the meeting illustrated China's broad mind and constructive approach to minimizing miscalculation and bringing the relations out of a low point.

;

; Wang Dong, a professor and executive director of the Institute for Global Cooperation and Understanding at Peking University, said that the meeting was "an impressive, amiable personal effort made by the Chinese head of state to appeal to and help US lawmakers to perceive China properly with a cool head, giving a boost to improving the ties".

;

; "Xi's call for the broad-mindedness of a major country sent the message that Washington should not be obsessed with securing its hegemony and selfish interests," he said.

;

; Su Xiaohui, deputy director of the China Institute of International Studies' Department of American Studies, said both sides reaffirmed the importance of their ties at the meeting, and Beijing made it clear that repairing the damage to the relations caused by the US side requires breaking away from a Cold War mentality and a zero-sum game approach.

;

; "The remarks made by the US side at the meeting show that the US, at federal, congressional and state levels, has also realized that it is impossible for the US to totally break away from China, and they are also not willing to do so," Su said.

;

; "The key for getting the ties back on track lies in pragmatic cooperation, and both sides should work to make sure the established cooperative mechanisms function properly and evenly. This will be conducive to both sides managing and controlling their divergences and stabilizing relations," she said.

;

; The US delegation, which arrived in Shanghai on Saturday, will also travel to Xi'an, Shaanxi province.

;

; Xi told the US lawmakers that more members of Congress are welcome to visit China "to gain a better understanding of China's past, present and future".

;

; He also voiced hope that the legislative bodies of the two countries will have more visits, dialogues and exchanges to enhance mutual understanding and make contributions to stabilizing and improving China-US relations.

;

; The US lawmakers told Xi that they are very pleased to visit China, and they appreciated the Chinese side's great hospitality, which enabled them to feel the vigor and potential of the country's development.

;

; The US is willing to strengthen dialogue and communication with China in the spirit of openness, frankness and mutual respect, manage the two countries' ties in a responsible way, and advance the stable development of US-China relations, they said.

;

; The US delegation also met with Zhao Leji, chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee, and Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing on Monday.
